t: Proverbs 12
Whoever*pn loves instruction loves knowledge, But*ld he who hates correction is*i stupid.
A*ln good man*i obtains favor from the Lord,*s But*ld a man of wicked intentions He will condemn.
A*ln man is not established by wickedness, But*ld the root of the righteous cannot be moved.
An*ln excellent wife is*i the crown of her husband, But*ld she who causes shame is*i like rottenness in his bones.
The*ln thoughts of the righteous are*i right, But*ild the counsels of the wicked are*i deceitful.
The*ld words of the wicked are,*i “Lie in wait for blood,” But*ld the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
The*ln wicked are overthrown and are*i no more, But*ld the house of the righteous will stand.
A*ln man will be commended according to his wisdom, But*ld he who is of a perverse heart will be despised.
Better*ln is*i the*i one*i who is slighted but has a servant, Than*ld he who honors himself but lacks bread.
A*ln righteous man*i regards the life of his animal, But*ld the tender mercies of the wicked are*i cruel.
He*ln who tills his land will be satisfied with bread, But*ld he who follows frivolity is*i devoid of understanding.
The*ln wicked covet the catch of evil men,*i But*ld the root of the righteous yields fruit.*i
The*ld wicked is ensnared by the transgression of his*i lips, But*ld the righteous will come through trouble.
A*ld man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his*i mouth, And*ld the recompense of a man’s hands will be rendered to him.
The*ln way of a fool is*i right in his own eyes, But*ld he who heeds counsel is*i wise.
A*ld fool’s wrath is known at once, But*ld a prudent man*i covers shame.
He*ld who*i speaks truth declares righteousness, But*ld a false witness, deceit.
There*ld is one who speaks like the piercings of a sword, But*ld the tongue of the wise promotes*i health.
The*ld truthful lip shall be established forever, But*ld a lying tongue is*i but for a moment.
Deceit*ld is in the heart of those who devise evil, But*ld counselors of peace have joy.
No*ld grave trouble will overtake the righteous, But*ld the wicked shall be filled with evil.
Lying*ld lips are*i an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ld those who deal truthfully are*i His delight.
A*ln prudent man conceals knowledge, But*ld the heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
The*ln hand of the diligent will rule, But*ld the lazy man*i will be put to forced labor.
Anxiety*ln in the heart of man causes depression, But*ld a good word makes it glad.
The*ln righteous should choose his friends carefully, For*ld the way of the wicked leads them astray.
The*ln lazy man*i does not roast what he took in hunting, But*ld diligence is*i man’s precious possession.
In*ln the way of righteousness is*i life, And*ld in its*i pathway there*i is*i no death.
